body_html:
@terribilissimo After inspecting the log, the following two libraries caused the problem.

c:\windows\system32\MSVCP140.DLL
c:\windows\system32\VCRUNTIME140.DLL

I've uploaded the right version here.
Put the files into [Anaconda env path]\Lib\site-packages\torch\lib and it should be fine.
If the CPU version works, then the GPU should be working afterwards once you do the same thing.
body_text:

c:\windows\system32\MSVCP140.DLL
c:\windows\system32\VCRUNTIME140.DLL

body:
@terribilissimo  After inspecting the log, the following two libraries caused the problem.
```
c:\windows\system32\MSVCP140.DLL
c:\windows\system32\VCRUNTIME140.DLL
```
I've uploaded the right version [here](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/files/1622048/vc.zip).
Put the files into `[Anaconda env path]\Lib\site-packages\torch\lib` and it should be fine.
If the CPU version works, then the GPU should be working afterwards once you do the same thing.
